thread.title: United front? Bannon & Priebus talk ‘economic nationalism,’ Trump deregulation, and more at CPAC
thread.title_full: United front? Bannon & Priebus talk ‘economic nationalism,’ Trump deregulation, and more at CPAC

author: RT
title: United front? Bannon & Priebus talk ‘economic nationalism,’ Trump deregulation, and more at CPAC
text:
United front? Bannon & Priebus talk ‘economic nationalism,’ Trump deregulation, and more at CPAC   23:40 Get short URL White House Chief Strategist Stephen Bannon (L) and White House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus © Joshua Roberts / Reuters Rumors of divisions within the White House were either dispelled or proven depending on who was watching, when President Donald Trump’s chief strategist Stephen Bannon and chief of staff Reince Priebus took the stage at CPAC. 
On Thursday at the 2017 Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC), Bannon and Priebus sat down with Matt Schlapp, chairman of the American Conservative Union, which hosts the annual gathering of thousands of activists. 
The “big moment,” as the interview was cast, began with a question on media accuracy. Reports of feuding between Bannon, former executive chair of Breitbart News, and Priebus, former chair of the Republican National Committee, were downplayed immediately. 
“In regard to us two, I think the biggest misconception is everything that you’re reading,” Priebus told the crowd, adding that when the Republican Party and conservative movement joins together as he and Bannon have, “it can’t be stopped.” 
Bannon agreed, attributing their cohesive relationship to the leadership of Trump, who the chief strategist said brought the ideas, energy and vision that could galvanize people. At one point, they were asked to comment on each other. Priebus called Bannon “incredibly loyal” and “extremely consistent,” while Bannon complimented Priebus as “unwavering.” 
Not all who watched the interview were convinced. WEIRD! Anyone Catch Bannon Grabbing Priebus and then his reaction? pic.twitter.com/YVE22Mg8TO 
READ MORE: President Trump’s 1st month leaves Americans divided in polls 
Some took issue with the interview overall, while others praised it. Hey @mschlapp , not one question to Bannon or Priebus about Russia? I guess we'll have to leave that to the elitist media. #CPAC2017 — David Corn (@DavidCornDC) February 23, 2017 Would CPAC kick out Steve Bannon & Steve Miller from their conservative conference? Because they believe what Milo & Richard Spencer believe — Shaun King (@ShaunKing) February 23, 2017 Steve Bannon is absolutely brilliant. Makes perfect sense that so many globalist/socialist types would want him out of the WH. #CPAC — Asa J 🇺🇸 (@asamjulian) February 23, 2017 Bannon is really smart. A critical part of the Trump agenda is "The deconstruction of the regulatory state." — Laura Ingraham (@IngrahamAngle) February 23, 2017 
Bannon called the media “corporatist” and “globalist,” adding that they “are adamantly opposed to an economic nationalist agenda.” 
On carrying out that agenda, Bannon said they were “maniacally focused” to make sure “all of those promises are going to be implemented.” 
The vision goes beyond changing America over the next four years, but “potentially over 40 years,” Priebus said, citing Supreme Court justice nominee Neil Gorsuch and Trump’s executive order putting into place a “constant deregulatory flow” where two regulations are repealed for every new one implemented. 
Bannon and Priebus each highlighted different issues, with Bannon sounding off on more nationalist appeals than Priebus’ traditional points. 
“We’re a nation with a culture and a reason for being,” Bannon said. 
Priebus did hit the media just as hard as Bannon, explaining that reports on Trump during the campaign were inconsistent with what he heard back home from neighbors. But Priebus did share his feeling that the media might learn from its mistake. Bannon, however, was less optimistic, predicting the coverage would only get worse. 
“If you think you’re going to win this country back without a fight, you’re mistaken,” Bannon said.
